newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ adds word "compulsory" to referendum question.
newsitem.headline: NZ adds word "compulsory" to referendum question.

text.p: Parliament's Electoral Law Select Committee on Thursday added the word "compulsory" to the question in the September superannuation referendum.
The committee changed the wording to: "Do you support the proposed compulsory retirement savings scheme?"
The committee did not set a required level of turnout or majority required for the referendum to be accepted.
The bill will be debated in parliament next week.
